issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Having S3 be set to localhost will cause determinstic failures in:
# Object download
# Stack creation

We should let both users and administrators know that their operations will fail.
fields.summary: Add warning at service start and in browser when S3 host is set to localhost

comments.body: So, [~viglesias], what do we tell users to do to fix the error?

[~lnajjar]

The user needs to set ufshost in the /etc/eucaconsole/console.ini file to either:
* the subdomain of their cloud (if they have DNS enabled)
* the IP of their User Facing Service machine

I've created the log warning:

2015-09-25 15:00:33 WARNING 'ufshost' needs to be set to something externally resolvable.Stack creation and object download will not work properly until this is fixed.

I check ufshost and clchost in case someone is still using clchost. Use of clchost still produces the deprecated warning as well.

What should I do for user messaging? Should this be on the Login screen like https or javascript warnings? (assigned to Lawrence for UX input)

[~viglesias], I see where users enter an S3 host for Object Download (see "Object download with S3 path" attachment).

I had trouble finding a field for entering S3 host for Create Stack (see the three "Create Stack" attachments).

Will you please tell me where users enter an S3 localhost for Create Stack?

[~dkavanagh], to reduce the chance users will get this error, I changed the bubble help on the Buckets "Download Object" dialog to: Enter the full path to the object, including bucket name. Do not use localhost.

[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Download+object]

Will you please change it in the code?

I'm still working on other improvements. More to come. :)

[~viglesias] & [~dkavanagh], here are draft warnings.

Will you please take a look and improve them?

For object download:

_Object <object name> download failed. You cannot set S3 to localhost. In your /eucaconsole/console.ini file set ufshost to the:
* Subdomain of your cloud if you have DNS enabled
* Internet protocol address of your User Facing Service (UFS) machine_

For stack creation:

_Create <stack name> stack failed. You cannot set S3 to localhost. In your /eucaconsole/console.ini file set ufshost to the:
* Subdomain of your cloud if you have DNS enabled
* Internet protocol address of your User Facing Service (UFS) machine_

I suggest we keep things simple for the user. Don't tell them how to configure ufshost since they can't do it. let them know there is a mis-configuration and direct them to their cloud administrator. Tell them enough to let the admin know what to fix, so how about "This feature won't work properly due to a misconfiguration. Please ask your administrator to change the ufshost setting per our documentation"

For object details page:

1.  On line below the bad link, display the red warning triangle icon
2. Then to the right of the icon, display red text: This link will not work because it includes localhost. Please ask your administrator to change the ufshost setting to the fully qualified domain name or the IP address of the machine running User Facing Services.

For stack creation:

1. On Dashboard, when user clicks "Create stack," display the following error popup message (dialog with a Cancel button and error icon): You cannot create a stack because the ufshost setting includes localhost. Please ask your administrator to change the ufshost setting to the fully qualified domain name or the IP address of the machine running User Facing Services.
2. On the Stack landing page, when user clicks "Create stack," display the same error popup message as in #1.

[~dkavanagh], as we discussed, here are the three wireframes I updated for you:

[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Dashboard] (see the new note on the create stacks error)

[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Stacks+landing+page] (see the new note on the stacks landing page)

[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Cannot+create+stack] (this is the reused "Cannot create stack" error light box)

Let me know how these look. I'm attaching screen shots of the dialog and link message since it's hard to reproduce w/ laptop (I used nginx to create a proxy)

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1607

[~dkavanagh], thanks for sharing the screen caps since I cannot verify using my laptop.

Based on your screen caps, everything looks good with one minor exception. To be consistent with other warning dialogs (see [https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+Load+Balancer]), I thought we might want to add a "Close" button at the bottom.

So, I updated the wireframe to include a "Close" button: [https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Cannot+create+stack]

Could you please add that button then return this ticket to me to approve?
[~lnajjar], Where have we added a close button to this kind of dialog? AFAIK, if there isn't an action to follow, we simply let the closing "X" be used to dismiss the dialog.

I found all the popup messages without an action. So, these are pure warnings. 

One warning did not have a button:
[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+stack]

Three warnings did have a button:
[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+Load+Balancer]
[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Load+balancer+details]
[https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Security+Group+Details]

So, the majority have buttons. Plus, popup windows usually have a close button:

[https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dn742473%28v=vs.85%29.aspx]
[https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/MobileHIG/Alerts.html]
[http://www.deepsloweasy.com/hfe%20resources/enterprise%20wide%20guiguide.pdf]

Could you please add a "Close" button as shown here: [https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Cannot+create+stack]

[~lnajjar], I think the 3 examples you showed proved my point in that we never have a button at the bottom that just closes the dialog. It is always to confirm an action, so the button is a "confirm", not a "close".

We need a button to close the warning dialog. It is standard in user interface design guidelines to include a button to close a warning dialog:

[https://www.google.com/search?q=warning+popup&espv=2&biw=1201&bih=540&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ved=0CCcQsARqFQoTCLvVhsXbn8gCFYaXgAodd2gBqg]
[https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dn742473%28v=vs.85%29.aspx]
[http://www.deepsloweasy.com/hfe%20resources/enterprise%20wide%20guiguide.pdf] (Go to "Different Message Types")

I prefer "Close" over "OK" because clicking on the button performs a close action.
I'm just going on something Jenny had talked about w/ me, but I'll throw this in there and let you two sort it out when she gets back.

OK. Good, good. Let's keep moving.

[~dkavanagh], as you wrote in an earlier comment, I cannot verify the change: 

_...I'm attaching screen shots of the dialog and link message since it's hard to reproduce w/ laptop (I used nginx to create a proxy)_

Will you please do that again? If you can grab a screen shot in each of the major browsers that would allow us to move this one on.

I've attached a screenshot showing the new dialog w/ close button. I've also attached a collection of 3 dialogs I found (and I didn't search beyond that) which only have the close "X" button. I was going for consistency. That's why I was resisting the close button.

Verified via [~dkavanagh]'s screen capture (see attachment).

UX review passed. Ready for code review.
done!

[~dkavanagh]: The latest commit was pushed to the wrong branch (notice the lowercase "i" in GUi)...
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/eed37d4bd8f6
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1616
PR 1616 merged

[~dkavanagh]: Wasn't there a plan to also have a warning message about not using localhost in the console.ini upon service startup?  Or is this not necessary since the service is now set to auto-start upon install?
[~ccassler], yes, this code does that: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/config.py#L95-L100
[~dkavanagh]: Ah, ok.  It's logged to eucaconsole.log.  I was looking for it in stdout.

This looks good.  I was able to see all warnings about using localhost in console.ini and S3.

PR 1620 merged

Verified.  Close button is gone.
